comments.author: mmarks@ghotinet.net
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 SearchToolbar/1.2
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 SearchToolbar/1.2

I was downloading a file and I believe I attempted to pause the file right at the moment when the download completed. The file opened but it remained in the download manager labeled as "paused". Now I am completely unable to remove the file from my download manager. "Resume" does nothing; "cancel" does nothing; "clear link" does nothing. I went so far as to delete my browsing and download history, but the link is still there.

It seems like it would be difficult to reproduce the problem, since I paused at the exact moment the file completed. Honestly, it's not a serious problem, but I'd really like to get that stupid file out of my download manager - with the Download Statusbar extension, it's sitting right there mocking me all the time and I'm sick of it. If there's a straightforward fix or workaround for this problem I'd love to hear it.

Reproducible: Didn't try




I am using the "Download Statusbar" extension v0.9.7.2. Disabling the extension does not help. Starting in safe mode does not help. I cannot remove the file from either the Download Statusbar extension or the Download Manager.
comments.creator: mmarks@ghotinet.net

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:21.0) Gecko/20130119 Firefox/21.0 ID:20130119030922

Clear Downloads Not clearing full.

When i click the Clear Download buttons it Not clearing full, it keep showing two downloads history.
